intro: Echinospermum lappuloides, commonly known as the hairy lappula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Echinospermum lappuloides is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, where it thrives in open, sunny conditions.
